text:
Dividing by standard deviation cubed standardizes the statistic and allows interpretation
of the skewness measure. If relative skewness is equal to zero, the data is not skewed.
Positive levels of relative skewness imply a positively skewed distribution, whereas
negative values of relative skewness imply a negatively skewed distribution. Values of SK
in excess of 0.5 in absolute value indicate significant levels of skewness.
